subject: Standardization of Display of User fee Related Hoardings
text: 9ay 7751 <GrArf Melabr01 Phone 9i-11-25074100/25074200 Fax 91-11-25093507/25093514 (43a5 Aae7 3 <TTHTf 4nretq) Extn. 2223/2318/2468/2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport & Highways) 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110045 NHAI/13013/3/02-03/CMD-COPPolicy in Toll January 06, 2004 Circular No: NHAIICOMMERCIAL OPERATION/35 Subject: Stondardization_of_Display of_User fee Related Hoarding It has been observed that various hoardings relating to user fee, list of exempted category etc. vary in dimension; font size and placement at different user fee collection plazas: This needs standardization for sake of uniformity all over the country: Accordingly it has been decided to issue the following guidelines for strict compliance with immediate effect for public funded projects: Hoardings from both the approaching sides relating to "User fee" (UF) has been depicted as UF-1(H), UF-2 (E); and UF-3 (R) in the enclosed layout plan: For size of the display board in English, please refer to Annexure-I. ii Since it has been experienced that the list of "Exempted Category" of vehicles cannot be accommodated on one hoarding, it would be displayed on two hoardings viz, Exempted Category (EC) & Exempted Dignitaries (ED): In the enclosed layout plan, it has been reflected as EC-1(H), EC-2(E), EC-3(R), and ED-1 (H), ED-2 (E) & ED-3 (R). For size of the display boards in English, please refer to Annexure-I iii: Hoardings relating to "Concession" (CN) has been reflected as CN-1 (H), CN-2 (E); and CN-3 (R) in the enclosed layout plan: iv. Placards providing detail of user fee in Regional languages shall also be placed just above the ticket window of the booth and also on the approaching side wall of the booth: It has been reflected as "UF" in the enclosed layout V UFRB and UFRE boards, currently intended for an isolated individual section must be suitably modified to destination boards (as it looses significance) when the adjacent sections are subjected to levy of fee.
